events.name: Agile Singapore 2016 Conference
events.description: Please visit http://2016.agilesingapore.org for more details and registration.
events.location: Hotel Fort Canning, 11 Canning Walk, Singapore

events.name: Introduction to PayPal API & Async Workshop
events.description:
The session will help you enhance your applications with PayPal’s APIs. These APIs include functionality for Payments, Authorizations, Billing plans, Pay-outs and much more. You will also be introduced to Async, a utility module which provides straight-forward, powerful functions for working with asynchronous JavaScript.

The speaker, Aeshan Wijetunge, is currently a web developer @ PayPal and has previously held posts at HardwareZone and SPH Magazines.

Sign up for this or any of the other $PATH to iNTUition workshops at https://ieeentu.typeform.com/to/SAqemr.

events.name: Kx Technology for Bitcoin Trading and Financial Applications
events.description:
We are hosting a Kx Meetup on Thursday, October 6 @ 6:30pm. Location is Penny Black on Boat Quay.  Our speaker line up includes presentations from Bitmex and Kx Labs.  We hope to see you there! Agenda  Arthur Hayes, co-founder and CEO of BitMEX, will talk about how he built a derivatives exchange in kdb+. BitMEX is a trading platform that gives retail investors access to the global financial markets using Bitcoin, the Blockchain, and financial derivatives. Martin Haines, APAC Managing Director at First Derivatives, will provide an update on FD/Kx rebranding and introduce the new FD and Kx websites.  Dave Thomas, Chief Scientist/CSO Kx Labs will discuss the current product roadmap at KX Labs and lead a Q&A after the presentations. 

Please RSVP to [masked] to secure your place.

events.name: Singapore Magento User Group Meetup - Oct 2016
events.description:
Date: Thursday, 06 Oct 2016Venue: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina BoulevardLevel 22,[masked], SingaporeTime: 7:00 - 9:00PM Agenda:  1. Effective TDD with Magento 2 by Michael Cheng Michael Cheng is a full stack developer with more than 10 years of experience building dynamic websites. He is a Zend Certified Engineer/Trainer in PHP development. He runs the Singapore PHP User Group, co-founded the iOS Dev Scouts and is the organiser of PHPConf.Asia. His one of passion project is Engineers.SG, a not-for-profit community initiative to document and archive the tech and startup scene in Singapore. 2. Best practices for UI/UX in eCommerce by KC Kali Charan Rajput (KC): UI/UX Lead at Ranosys Technologies India. KC has over 7 years of experience in UI/UX and has vast expertise in eCommerce user experience.KC main focus is on Design User Interface (UI) focusing on anticipating what users might need to do and ensuring that the interface has elements that are easy to access and understand. 3.  Production Deployment of Magento on Azure by Gerald Goh.Gerald Goh: Gerald is a technical evangelist at Microsoft Singapore’s Developer Experience & Evangelism Team. He is a full stack developer with over 5 years experience developing web applications. He currently does Python and is working on DevOps, Infrastructure, Data Engineering and Distributed Systems. 4. Data Driven Marketing for Magento by Justin YekJustin Yek: Partner & Co-founder of Altitude Labs. Justin is having bachelor degree from Columbia University in the City of New York. He has keen interested in eCommerce Marketing and his company is offering some useful products in marketing. 


Connect with us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/SingaporeMagentoUserGroup/ Pizza and drink are sponsor by Microsoft Singapore :) :)
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, 018989, Singapore

events.name: ArtScience Late: Dan Deacon's Change Your Life (You Can Do It!)
events.description:
Change Your Life (You Can Do It) with Dan Deacon
Thursday 6 October 2016 | 8pm Expression Gallery (Level 4)
Free admission

Baltimore-based experimental electronic producer performer Dan Deacon has released multiple critically-acclaimed albums and gained a reputation for his wildly entertaining interactive live shows in DIY spaces. It’s one of most exuberant experiences you can have in electronic music and must be experienced live to be truly understood.

http://bit.ly/DanDeaconASL
